name: Admiral
description: Bittering hops derived from Wye Challenger. Good high-alpha bittering hops.Aroma: Primarily for bittering

name: Ahtanum
description: Distinctive aromatic hops with moderate bittering power from Washington.Aroma: Distinctive floral and citrus aromas

name: Amarillo
description: Unknown origin, but character similar to Cascade.  Used for both bitterness and aroma.Aroma: Citrus, flowery

name: Apollo
description: Super high alpha variety from the Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006.  High alpha and low cohumulone makes it a great bittering hop.  Adds a strong grapefruit/hop note if added late in boil.

name: Aquila
description: Aroma hops developed in 1988.  Limited use due to high cohumolone.No longer commercially grown.

name: Atlas
description: A cross between Brewers Gold and Slovenian wild hops.  Primarily a bittering hop with pleasant bitterness and aroma.

name: Aurora
description: Also called Super Styrian.  This is a hybrid between Northern Brewer and TG.  It has a pleasant hoppy aroma similar to Styrian Goldings but lighter.
beer_style: Often mixed with other hops in lagers.

name: Banner
description: Bittering hops developed in 1988.  Use largely discontinued due to poor storage.

name: Bobek
description: Also called Styrian Golding B - a cross between Northern Brewer and a TG seedling.  Pleasant hop aroma and flavor.

name: Bramling Cross
description: Developed in 1927 from commercial Goldings and wild hop variety.Aroma: Mild, fruity, currant aroma.

name: Bravo
description: A second generation super high alpha hops from the Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006.  Good bittering hop.Aroma: Fruity and floral aroma.

name: Brewers Gold
description: Traditional bittering hops for English ales and heavy German lagers.Aroma: Sharp bittering hopExample: Petes Wicked Ale

name: Bullion
description: Used in strong dark English ales, some heavy German lagers.Aroma: Strong, pungent and bitter in flavor.  Blackcurrant flavor.

name: Cascade - 2014-06 Hopunion
description: A hops with Northern Brewers HeritageAroma: Strong spicy, floral, grapefruit characterExamples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

name: Celeia
description: A bittering & aroma hops that is a hybrid between Savinjski Golding, Aurora and Slovenian wild hops.  Similar in aroma to Saaz.

name: Centennial
description: Aroma: Floral, citrus aroma, spicy, clean bittering flavorExamples: Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale, Sierra Nevada Bigfoot
beer_style: General purpose bittering, aroma in American ales and Wheats

name: Challenger
description: Variant of Northern Brewers heritageAroma: Fruity in flavor, spicy aroma, blends well
beer_style: Both aroma and bittering for ales and lagers

name: Chelan
description: High alpha variety from the Haas breeding program released in 2004.  It is a variant of Galena and very similar in profile to Galena.Aroma: Pleasant citrus notes

name: Chinook
description: Strong versatile bittering hopAroma: Heavy and spicy aromaExamples: Sierra Nevada Stout, Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale

name: Citra
description: Special aroma hops released in 2007.  Imparts high alpha/oil content but low cohumulone.Aroma: Adds interesting citrus and tropical fruit character to the beer.

name: Cluster
description: Aroma: Floral, slightly spicy. Sharp aroma and sharp flavor

name: Columbia
description: Sibling of Williamette hops.Aroma: Close to Fuggles

name: Columbus (Tomahawk)
description: Engineered Centennial Substitute - High alpha bittering hops.Aroma: Pungent, spicy. Strongly aromatic, but clean tasting bitterness
beer_style: Bittering, flavor, aroma - IPA, American Pale Ale, Stout, Lager

name: Comet - 2013-08 - Hopsdirect
description: Very bitter hops - use sparingly with other hops

name: Crystal 2013
description: Aroma: Clean, mild, pleasant and slightly spicy
beer_style: Aroma and finishing hops for Lagers

name: Eroica
description: Aroma: Clean bittering hop, very bitterExamples: Blackhook Porter, Ballard Bitter
beer_style: General purpose bittering for ales, porters, stouts

name: Feux Coeur Francais
description: Rare, high alpha hops from Australia with genetic roots in the Burgundy region of France.  It was adopted to the Victoria region of Australia and introduced in 2010.

name: First Gold
description: Dwarf hop with English Golding characterAroma: Similar to other Golding varieties, spicy

name: Fuggles
description: Aroma: Mild, soft, grassy, floral aromaSubstitute: East Kent Goldings, WilliametteExamples: Samuel Smiths Pale Ale, Old Peculiar, Thomas Hardys Ale
beer_style: General purpose bittering/aroma for English Ales, Dark Lagers

name: Galaxy
description: A high alpha, bittering & aroma seedless hops with a unique hop aroma.  It can be used either for bittering or as a late hop addition to provide a flavor of citrus and passionfruit to the finished beer.Aroma: Intense, pleasant, unique.

name: Galena
description: Aroma: Strong, clean, balanced bitteringExamples: Catamount Porter
beer_style: General bittering hops for all beers

name: Glacier
description: Genetic mix of at least 8 hops including Elsasser, Brewers Gold, N Brewer, Bullion, Early Green, and others...released in 2000.Aroma: Excellent, hoppy

name: Goldings, B.C.
description: Aroma: Spicy, floral, rounded mild aroma.
beer_style: Bittering and finishing British ales, bitters, porters and stouts.

name: Goldings, Kent - 2013-09 - HE
description: Aroma: Floral, aromatic, earthy, slightly sweet spicy flavorExamples: Bass Pale Ale, Fullers ESB, Samual Smiths Pale Ale
beer_style: General purpose hops for bittering/finishing all British Ales

name: Green Bullet
description: Bittering hops from New Zealand developed in 1972Aroma: Floral, raisin aroma.

name: Greenburg
description: American hop variety from southern Idaho.  Fruity flavor with a touch of wood flavor.  Popular with microbreweries.

name: Hallertauer
description: Aroma: Pleasant, mild spicy flavor, clean, neutral flavor
beer_style: German Ales, German/US/Canadian Lagers, Wheat Beers

name: Hallertauer Hersbrucker
description: Aroma: Noble, pleasant, clean flavorExamples: Wheathook Wheaten Ale
beer_style: German style lagers and wheat beers

name: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh
description: Aroma: Pleasant, assertive, mild herbal aromaExamples: Sam Adams Boston Lager, Sam Adams Boston Lightship
beer_style: Continental Lagers, German Ales/Lagers, US Lagers

name: Hallertauer, New Zealand
description: Hallertauer variant with classic aroma and ability to retain clean taste. Bred from German Hallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Herald
description: Dwarf variety bred at Wye College (mid 1990s)Aroma: Strong, acceptable

name: Horizon
description: Good bittering & aroma hops derived from Nugget hops in Oregon (1970)Aroma: Pleasant, hoppy
sub_names: Magnum or other high alpha hops

name: Liberty
description: Aroma: Fine, mild, slightly spicy flavorExamples: Petes Wicked Lager

name: Lublin
description: Version of Saaz grown in Poland - also called "Lubelski"Aroma: Noble, mild flavor similar to Saaz

name: Magnum
description: German Hallertauer hybrid, widely used in GermanyAroma: Good aroma and stable spicy flavor

name: Marynka
description: Bittering hops with high aroma.  Primarily for use in Pilsner, lagers, ales or wheats.  Comparable to English Goldings or Chinook.

name: Millenium
description: Originally developed as part of the Haas breeding program in the US, Millenium entered production in 2000.  It is a very high alpha hops used for bittering.Aroma: Mild, herbal

name: Motueka
description: Flexible hop developed from Saaz.  Has notable character and aroma, balanced bitterness, and unique flavor.
beer_style: Lagers, Belgian Ales and Bohemian Pilsner.

name: Mt. Hood
description: Aroma: Mild with a clean aroma, neutral flavor. Somewhat pungent.

name: Nelson Sauvin
description: Triploid variety bred from "Smoothcone" released in 2000.  Oil profile said to taste like "fresh crushed gooseberries" similar to Sauvignon Blanc, giving it its name.  Very fruity, citrusy - use in moderation.

name: Newport
description: High alpha hops released in 2002 as a potential replacement for Galena.  Note that these hops have a large alpha range of 9.8%-17% so check the package!  Fairly pungent.
beer_style: Primarily used for bittering in ales, stouts, barley wine.

name: Northdown
description: Variation of Northern Brewers hops grown in England.Aroma: Good bittering, flavor and aroma

name: Northern Brewer
description: Also called Hallertauer Northern BrewersAroma: Fine, dry, clean bittering hop.  Unique flavor.Examples: Anchor Steam, Old Peculiar,
beer_style: Bittering and finishing both ales and lagers of all kinds

name: Nugget
description: Aroma: Strong bittering, heavy, herbal aroma, spicyExamples: Sierra Nevada Porter

name: Olympic
description: Olympic is a high alpha hops released by Washington Agricultural Expt Station in 1983.  Heritage is from Brewers Gold and Fuggles.Aroma: Spicy, citrus aroma

name: Opal
description: New variety from the hop research center in Hull.Aroma: High aroma hops with hints of spice and subtle citrus.

name: Orion
description: Cross between Perle and an experimental varietyAroma: Pleasant, hoppy

name: Pacific Gem
description: High alpha smoothcone cross developed at DSIR in 1987.Aroma: Pleasant - some blackberry aroma.
beer_style: Bittering - produces a cask-oak woody flavor.

name: Pacific Jade
description: High alpha bittering hops that delivers a bold herbal infusion of fresh citrus with some black pepper flavor.  Citrus aroma and flavor tempers ales and may be used as a finishing hops.

name: Pacifica
description: Aroma hop developed from Hallertauer Mittelfrueh in New Zealand (1994).  Blend of old and new world taste including Orange marmalade and citrus aroma notes when used in late addition.  Soft finish if used in bittering.

name: Palisade - 2013-12 - ABC Holiday Party Prize
description: Also called YCR-4, Palisade is an aroma variety bread by Yakima Chief Ranches.  It has both aromatic and moderate bittering properties.

name: Perle
description: Aroma: Slightly spicy, pleasant aroma, mintyExamples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Pale Bock
beer_style: General purpose bittering for US and German ales, lagers

name: Phoenix
description: Seedling derived from Wye Yoeman.Aroma: Similar to Wye Challenger hops

name: Pilgrim
description: New variety from Wye College in 2001.  High Selinene content.

name: Pilot
description: A very new hops introduced in 2002 by Charles Faram & Co Ltd.  Mild herbal flavor with lemon hints and fresh mowed grass flavor.  Rare.

name: Pioneer
description: Bred from Wye Omega at Wye College in the UKAroma: Mild English hop aroma

name: Premiant
description: A cross between Czech aroma and bittering varieties.  bittering & aroma though its aroma is not as strong as some other Czech hops.  Use in beers where a moderate hoppy aroma is needed.

name: Pride of Ringwood
description: Aroma: Moderate citric aroma, clean bittering flavor
beer_style: General purpose bittering hops for Australian beers

name: Progress
description: Aroma: Similar to Fuggles, aromatic, slightly sweet
beer_style: Bittering and aroma in English Ales

name: Riwaka
description: Formerly called B-Saaz, this was developed from old line Saazer hops in New Zealand.  Aroma: Strong, hoppy. Some grapefruit and citrus character.
beer_style: New world pale ale, regional pilsners

name: Saaz - 2014-06 Hopunion
description: Aroma: Delicate, mild, clean, somewhat floral -- Noble hopsExamples: Pulsner Urquell

name: Santiam
description: Triploid aroma selection derived from Tettnang and Hallertauer (1997)

name: Saphir
description: A new noble breed as an alternative to Hallertau Mittelfrueh in an attempt to make it more disease resistant and commercially viable.  Similar in character to Hallertau varieties.

name: Satus
description: High alpha bittering hops from Yakima that is similar to Galena.  Of recent origin.

name: Select Spalt
description: Bred from Hallertauer Mittelfrueh and Spalt in Germany.  Spalt character.Aroma: Very fine, spalt aroma
beer_style: Lager, Pilsner, Noble aroma hop substitute

name: Simcoe - 2013-08 - Freshops
description: High alpha bittering hops with good aroma characteristics.Aroma: Citrus and pine-like aroma

name: Sladek
description: Hybrid variety of Saaz origin with noble hoppy taste and aroma.  Generally recommended for middle-hopping about 20 min before end of boil.  Not a replacement for Saaz, but complimentary in Lagers.

name: Sorachi Ace
description: Developed by Sapporo Breweries and used in their beers - has a Brewers gold and Saaz heritage.  Reported to be lemony in flavor and aroma.
beer_style: Saison, IPA or other beer where lemon/citrus is desirable.

name: Southern Cross
description: bittering & aroma with "European" flavor - from DSIR in 1994Aroma: Spicy, lemony, slight pine and wood flavors

name: Spalter
description: Aroma: Mild, pleasant, slight spiceExamples: Dusseldorf Altbiers
beer_style: Traditional German bittering and aroma hops, Altbiers, Lagers

name: Sterling
description: Flavor is a cross between Saaz and Mt HoodAroma: Herbal, spicy, some floral and citrus hints

name: Sticklebract
description: High alpha hops from DSIR research first released in 1972.  Some of the same qualities as Northern BrewerAroma: Pine-like with a hint of citrus

name: Strisslespalt
description: Aroma hops used widely in the Alsace area of France.Aroma: Medium intensity, pleasant, hoppy

name: Styrian Goldings
description: A seedless version of Fuggles grown in SloveniaAroma: Mild, soft, grassy, floral aroma. Similar to Fuggles.
beer_style: Bittering, finishing for a wide variety of European Beers. Popular in Europe and the United Kingdom

name: Summit
description: High alpha variety bred by American Dwarf Hop Assoc.  Can be grown commercially on a low trellis.  Aroma: Strong citrus, grapefruit notes.

name: Sun
description: A very high alpha bittering hops from Yakima Valley, WashingtonAroma: Pleasant, hoppy
sub_names: Other very high alpha US hops

name: Super Alpha
description: High alpha hops released in 1976 by DSIR. European in character - clean crisp flavor and resin aroma.Aroma: Pleasant, resin like aroma

name: Super Galena
description: Super high alpha hops from Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006.  High alpha and beta content - comparable to Galena in bitterness and aroma profile.

name: Super Pride
description: A high alpha variation of the Pride of Ringwood hop variety.  Features mild aromas, higher alpha content and low cohumulone levels.

name: Target
description: Aroma: Robust aroma and flavor

name: Tettnang - 2013-11 - Knickerbocker Prize
description: Aroma: Noble, mild, fine, slightly spicyExamples: Sam Adams Octoberfest, Anderson Valley ESB
beer_style: German ales, lagers and wheat beer

name: Tillicum
description: High alpha and high beta hops developed though Haas breeding program and released in 1995.  Daughter variety of Galena and related to Chelan - so similar to both.

name: Tomahawk
description: Part of the Columbus/Tomahak/Zeus (CTZ) group of super high alpha hops.  Together these make up 1/4 of US hop acreage.
beer_style: High alpha hops used primarily for commercial bittering.

name: Topaz
description: Very high alpha hop variety from Australia.  Used for commercial production primarily for its high alpha acid content and high bitterness.

name: Tradition
description: Close descendant of Hallertauer Mittelfrueh bred for high yield.Aroma: Fine - similar to Hallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Ultra
description: Triploid seedling of the German Hallertauer VarietyAroma: Good to outstanding - some Saaz like qualities
beer_style: Lager, Pilsner, wheat, finishing hops in ales

name: Vanguard
description: Diploid seedling made in 1982, released in 1997. Hallertau Mitterfrueh parentage.Aroma: Strong aromatic notes

name: Victoria
description: Hi alpha hops grown in Victoria, Australia.  It was created in 1976 and entered commercial production in the 1990s.
beer_style: Primarily for bittering due to high alpha content.

name: Warrior
description: High alpha hops from Yakima Chief Ranches. Also called YCR-5.  Mild aroma and low cohumulone content - primarily for bittering.Aroma: Neutral, clean, mild

name: Whitbread Golding Variety (WGV)
description: Derived in England in 1911 from Bates Brewer. Some Golding characteristics, but lacking the full Goldings aroma.Aroma: Pleasant, hoppy, slightly intense

name: Willamette - 2014-06 Hopunion
description: Aroma: Mild, grassy, floral, slightly spicyExamples: Sierra Nevada Porter, Ballard Bitter

name: Zeus
description: Super high alpha bittering hops developed in the Yakima Valley, WAAroma: Aromatic, pleasant

name: Aged Hops (2008) - 2013-08 - Freshops
description: Lambic styles utilize older aroma types. Willamette is an English Fuggle hybrid, so it will provide mild bitterness and preservation to lambic beers.

name: Simcoe - 2014-08 Hopunion
description: High alpha bittering hops with good aroma characteristics.Aroma: Citrus and pine-like aroma

name: Comet
description: Very bitter hops - use sparingly with other hops

name: Tettnang
description: Aroma: Noble, mild, fine, slightly spicyExamples: Sam Adams Octoberfest, Anderson Valley ESB
beer_style: German ales, lagers and wheat beer

name: Palisade
description: Also called YCR-4, Palisade is an aroma variety bread by Yakima Chief Ranches.  It has both aromatic and moderate bittering properties.

name: Legacy - 2013-08
description: Stored in plastic zip-lock bags w/o O2 removal

name: Goldings, East Kent
description: Aroma: Floral, aromatic, earthy, slightly sweet spicy flavorExamples: Bass Pale Ale, Fullers ESB, Samual Smiths Pale Ale
beer_style: General purpose hops for bittering/finishing all British Ales

name: Fuggles - 2013-08 - HE
description: Aroma: Mild, soft, grassy, floral aromaSubstitute: East Kent Goldings, WilliametteExamples: Samuel Smiths Pale Ale, Old Peculiar, Thomas Hardys Ale
beer_style: General purpose bittering/aroma for English Ales, Dark Lagers

name: Northern Brewer - 2013-08 - Hops Direct
description: Also called Hallertauer Northern BrewersAroma: Fine, dry, clean bittering hop.  Unique flavor.Examples: Anchor Steam, Old Peculiar,
beer_style: Bittering and finishing both ales and lagers of all kinds

name: Magnum - 2013-08 - Hops Direct
description: German Hallertauer hybrid, widely used in GermanyAroma: Good aroma and stable spicy flavor

name: Simcoe
description: High alpha bittering hops with good aroma characteristics.Aroma: Citrus and pine-like aroma

name: Cascade
description: A hops with Northern Brewers HeritageAroma: Strong spicy, floral, grapefruit characterExamples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

name: Saaz
description: Aroma: Delicate, mild, clean, somewhat floral -- Noble hopsExamples: Pulsner Urquell

name: Willamette
description: Aroma: Mild, grassy, floral, slightly spicyExamples: Sierra Nevada Porter, Ballard Bitter

name: Crystal
description: Aroma: Clean, mild, pleasant and slightly spicy
beer_style: Aroma and finishing hops for Lagers
